commits_in_main.message: Merge commit
Added GUIPrefs for BV and Minimap summary imgs
GUIScale and TT Rework, part
More Lobby changes
Merge remote-tracking branch 'MM_Master/master' into TooltipReform
GameOptions allow hiding unoff and legacy opts
Merge branch 'master' into gameSummaryImages
Extract lobby mektable popup, unit selector correction
Merge remote-tracking branch 'MM_Master/master' into TooltipReform
PlayerColours, Colour Camo Standardization, and standardizing camo selector
Applying changes as per review
1727: Fixing duplicated player colours during initial assignment, provided there are free new colours
Merge remote-tracking branch 'MM_Master/master' into TooltipReform
Tooltip Ammo display, Random Army Dialog remembers size
+ Data:
Force Tree display work
Merge remote-tracking branch 'MM_Master/master' into TooltipReform
Moving the Image Choosers to use BaseComponents
Fixing merge conflicts
Adding the mek silhouette camo overlay
Minimap code, icons, game summary etc
CommonMenuBar rework contd
Corrections
Add further display styles for unit labels
Review changes
Merge remote-tracking branch 'MM_Master/master' into Menubar
Allow changing label style, kill preview Boardview when game starts
Revert "Revert "Dockable unit detail""
Update preference names for the unit detail window
Support saving detached state for UnitDetailsPane
GameOptionsDialog -> AbstractButtonDialog
Merge pull request #3233 from mjog/detachable-unit-detail-tweaks
Removing IBoardView and renaming BoardView1 to BoardView
General Code Cleanup - Focusing on Accessibility Problems
Starting changes from personal review and a fix things I missed
Tons of spacing and copyright header fixes
Fixing the remaining numbers and lowercase letters outside of f and 2
Improving detachable pane mode
Fixing merge conflicts
Issues 1896 and 3378: Adding MapTextColor and WarningColor to the advanced options
Initial work isolating the Entity inline enums into the commons enums
Handling most of the WeaponSortOrder Enum
Full revert of the dockable unit detail setup
Removing preference setup
Applying changes from personal review to ensure previous functionality
Standardizing minimap spelling to minimap over mini-map and mini map
Fixing further naming issues
Fixing merge conflicts
Merge branch 'master' into dev_Windchild_EntityInlineEnums
pip color by movement type. consoliate move and heat color lookups
Add advanced tmm pip property
address Windchild review suggestions
add advanced heat color options, centralize colors
adjust scale
css href and warning spans
cleanup
fix typos
properly render illegal moves as gray
move colors and html statics to TipUtil
heat and link color in advanced prefs

New AS Damage calculation / SUA calc updates / report updates

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (shouldIgnoreKeyCommands()) {
return false;
} else {
return true;
}
return !shouldIgnoreKeyCommands();
timeline.author: Windchild292

replies.bodyText: Oh indeed :) Never noticed. I'll correct this for all the other binds too.
replies.author: SJuliez

changed_code.chunk:
@@ -939,14 +940,14 @@ public class BoardView1 extends JPanel implements IBoardView, Scrollable,
 
     private boolean shouldIgnoreKeyCommands() {
         return getChatterBoxActive() || !isVisible()
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_LOUNGE)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_END_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_MOVEMENT_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_TARGETING_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_FIRING_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_PHYSICAL_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_OFFBOARD_REPORT)
-               || (game.getPhase() == Phase.PHASE_INITIATIVE_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.LOUNGE)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.END_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.MOVEMENT_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.TARGETING_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.FIRING_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.PHYSICAL_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.OFFBOARD_REPORT)
+               || (game.getPhase() == GamePhase.INITIATIVE_REPORT)
                || shouldIgnoreKeys;
     }

timeline.body: Before I continue I have to get clarification on this: Why are we saving values for a revert and not just having the update only occur when the dialog is saved?
timeline.bodyText: Before I continue I have to get clarification on this: Why are we saving values for a revert and not just having the update only occur when the dialog is saved?
timeline.bodyHTML: Before I continue I have to get clarification on this: Why are we saving values for a revert and not just having the update only occur when the dialog is saved?
timeline.author: Windchild292

replies.bodyText: Because these settings immediately show on the board or minimap so people can see the effect and to do this they must be saved to the GUIPrefs.
replies.author: SJuliez

replies.bodyText: That makes sense. I'll finish my review post-D&D
replies.author: Windchild292

timeline.body: Just checking, but we don't need to do either of these to properly update the board with the newly changed state?
timeline.bodyText: Just checking, but we don't need to do either of these to properly update the board with the newly changed state?
timeline.bodyHTML: Just checking, but we don't need to do either of these to properly update the board with the newly changed state?
timeline.author: Windchild292

replies.bodyText: No, these lines are actually nonsense I may have put in myself a few years ago. The boardview does preferencechange-listening and can update when such an event is fired. It just needs the right checks for what pref has changed to update accordingly. It could even update without checking what has changed but I think that's bad form, as all hexes have to be redrawn etc.
replies.author: SJuliez
